page.title: 06FARMING & PHEASANT- REARING
page.content: are stored until market conditions are favourable. They are then sorted & bagged; a task performed by women who are employed from November to March. The crop averages 1000 tonnes per year The wheat crop is sown in September of the year prior to harvest. One of the farmworkers used to live in nearby Matching but the steady reduction of rented accomodation due to purchase by retired buyers & commuters has caused him to move to Harlow New Town;only 10 minutes drive away.On land near to Roffey Hall, pheasants are bred by a retired London plumber. About 100 are released for the annual 'shoot'.Of these around 30 fall to the guns. In the interests of wild life conservation the shoot is only repeated annually.The same man is employed to destroy vermin-rabbits
